author: craigmcc
msg: Refactor the ActionServlet code so that subclasses can override individual
functional methods more gracefully.
This code does not yet reflect a change in the return value from
Action.perform() methods.  That will be next.

author: craigmcc
msg: Add the optional "target" attribute to <struts:form> and <struts:link>
for use in framed or multi-window presentations.

author: craigmcc
msg: Modify the behavior of the <struts:errors> tag.  Now, the string array
it accesses is expected to contain the message keys for the error messages
you wish to display, instead of the text of the messages themselves.  This
allows validation methods to generate errors without requiring access to
the user's Locale, or to the application's MessageResources object.

author: craigmcc
msg: Update the tag library descriptor, and associated documentation,
to reflect all the JavaScript event handler and stylesheet attributes
that were enabled by switching to BaseHandlerTag.
None of the new stuff has really been tested yet, but at least it does not
break the example application.
Fix a typo in the rendered HTML for the "styleClass" attribute -- it
should be "class", not "styleClass".

author: craigmcc
msg: Add the new <struts:button> custom tag, and the corresponding base class,
contributed by Don Clasen.  In addition, refactor most of the other input
tags to inherit from BaseHandlerClass so that they can be event-enabled
as well.
I have not yet modified the TLD (or the documentation) to reflect the new
attributes.  That is the next step.
